summary: A Script Dragon plugin that allows you to reset your perk points based on your level OR by taking all your current distributed and unallocated points into account. It has a configurable gold amount you have to pay per perk point (0 is possible though). It supports custom perk mods.
descriptionHtml:
A Script Dragon plugin that allows you to reset your perk points based on your level OR by taking all your current distributed and unallocated points into account. It has a configurable gold amount you have to pay per perk point (0 is possible though). It supports custom perk mods.

[color=red]UPDATE 25. MAR:[/color] Added custom perk resetting support. This build is experimental. If you encounter any issues try using the stable version without custom perk support. 

[u][b]INSTALLATION:[/u][/b]

Just get Script Dragon here and install it: 
Website: http://alexander.sannybuilder.com/?altname=skyrim_script_dragon
Direct Link: http://alexander.sannybuilder.com/Files/tes/ScriptDragon_1.5.24.0.zip

After Script Dragon installation, unzip the reset.zip into your Skyrim/asi folder.
Additionally, you may use NMM for being notified when a new version of this plugin is out but you should install it manually since NMM copies the files in the wrong directory (Data is wrong!).

[u][b]Activate it ingame with the INSERT key or get a cost preview with HOME/POS1.[/b][/u]

It supports vanilla Skyrim and PerkUP by default. For any other custom perk modification you have to create an id file under the ids folder and fill it with the appropriate perk ids. You can derive the format from the vanilla.ini file.

If you don\'t use any additional perk mods, you can safely remove the perkup.ini in the configuration file (reset.ini, sIdList=vanilla.ini,[color=red]perkup.ini[/color]) in order to speed up the first start.

NOTE: When you change your esp load order or edit the reset.ini file, please delete cache/remapped.dat if present or some of your perks may not get reset correctly.


[u][b]CONFIGURATION:[/u][/b]

The reset.ini states the following configurable values:
bDebug=1 // disable this for less verbosity
ResetKey=0x2D // this is your key for doing a perk reset (defaults to INSERT key)
ResetCostKey=0x24 //this is the key you can preview your reset cost with (defaults to HOME/POS1 key)
CostPerPerkPoint=100 // the amount of gold resetting each single perk point is going to cost you
MaximumResetCost=10000 // the maximum amount of gold you have to pay regardless of the number of perks reset
bPreservePerkPoints=1// preserves the amount of perk points you got through the console or other mods. Setting this to 0 calculates the amount of perk points based on your level instead.


[u][b]*ADVANCED*[/u][/b] - default values should be okay for the most.

[custom]
bCheckDuplicateFormIds=1	; you should leave this enabled when using custom perks

/*
	These are comma seperated id files (located in the ids folder) which are getting 
	parsed at runtime.
	Add id lists of custom perk modifications here.
	For example: When you are using the normal Skyrim perks, it has to be vanilla.ini.
	When using PerkUP it should be at least perkup.ini.
	When using multiple perk mods: mod1.ini,mod2.ini,mod3.ini ...
	Some mods that only modify some vanilla perks may also require the vanilla.ini 
	to be loaded.
*/

sIdList=vanilla.ini,perkup.ini

/*
	If you encounter missing refunded perk points after resetting, you can try to
	increase this value. Recommended are 0x01000000 steps.
	It should be in the range of 0x02000000 being the minimum and 0xFF000000 the maximum.
*/

UpperMemoryScanBoundary=0x0F000000

/*
	Eliminates the ~2 second game freeze after the first start if enabled.
	You have to delete cache/remapped.dat when changing your esp load order
 	or changing sIdList in this file. If this file is not created despite this option is
 	enabled, it may be due to the Windows User Account Control (UAC). Please
 	notify me about this issue then.
*/

bUseRemappingCache=1 




[b]Source: https://gitorious.org/tesv-modifications/tesv-modifications/trees/master/src/Reset[/b]
